intro: Spiradiclis pengshuiensis, commonly known as the Pengshui spiradiclis, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
